RELIEVE.Definition: rob or steal something from someone

LAND-ROBBER.Definition: someone who robs people on land

SEA-ROBBER.Definition: someone who robs people on sea

PISTOL.Definition: a small gun held in one hand

HOOK.Definition: a curved device used to catch things

CHRONICLED.Definition: provided a written record of something

MARITIME.Definition: connected with human activity at sea

PRIVATEER.Definition: a commander of his own ship authorised by a government during wartime to attack and capture enemy ships

STATE-SANCTIONED.Definition: given certain permissions from the government

DISRUPT.Definition: interrupt their activities and cause problems

CANNONS.Definition: large, powerful guns that fire metal balls

CREW.Definition: the group of people who work together on a ship

DISCIPLINE.Definition: the practice of training people to follow orders and obey

OPIUM.Definition: a drug made from the seeds of a flower called poppy

CRUCIALLY.Definition: in a way that is very important

FAIR GAME.Definition: something that is considered a reasonable target

TRANSITION.Definition: change from one form to another

LURED.Definition: attracted by the hope of something

HUNG.Definition: killed by tying a rope around his neck with no support from below

REMARKABLY.Definition: unusually and in a worth mentioning way

HIERARCHY.Definition: a system in which people are arranged according to their importance or rank

CREWS.Definition: groups of people who work together on a ship

MERITOCRATIC.Definition: a system in which advancement is based on individual ability

FORWARD-THINKING.Definition: forward-looking, ready to accept new ideas

INCENTIVE.Definition: something that encourages or motivates you to do something

HESITATE.Definition: have second thoughts or hold back in doing something

AGGRESSIVELY.Definition: in an angry and violent way

PLAITS.Definition: lengths of hair put over each other

SKULL AND CROSSBONES.Definition: a picture of a human skull above two crossed bones

IRONICALLY.Definition: in a way that is interesting because it is very different from what one would expect

LIEUTENANT.Definition: an officer rank in the armed forces

REWARD.Definition: something given in exchange for his good work

MASTS.Definition: the tall poles or posts of a ship that supports its sails

IN THE GRAND SCHEME OF THINGS.Definition: in the complete picture of things

BUST.Definition: show that they are not true

HOOKS.Definition: curved devices used to catch things

COMPENSATED.Definition: paid in exchange for something that has been lost or damaged

PROSTHETICS.Definition: artificial (made by human beings) body parts
